Key Match Events: Dawid Malan was first to go, edging into his stumps.
Joe Root lasted one ball, which arrowed low into his pads.
Ben Stokes played a ludicrous sideswipe at a straight one from Mohammed Shami and became the first of his four victims.
Virat Kohli attempted to drive David Willey through cover only for Malan to dive to his left and perfectly pouch the bouncing ball.
Chris Woakes bowled a seven-over opening spell that went for just 23 runs, a startling improvement on his first three World Cup games.

Shubman Gill scored 33, and Rohit Sharma went on to score another 54 off 52 to steady a briefly listing ship, assisted by KL Rahul (39 off 58) and Suryakumar Yadav, who fell one short of a half-century having faced 47.
Post-Match Reflections: Matthew Mott rejects Eoin Morganâ€™s claim of division in England squad
England at least produced half a good performance, which has to count as progress.
England have still not been eliminated from this competition and even after the guillotine falls they will have plenty of motivation for their three remaining fixtures.
Their players might not mind a bit of time off in early 2025 but their absence would be an embarrassment, and they have had enough of those of late.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India retained their 100% record and returned to the top of the group; England remained rock bottom.
England's bowlers were unrelenting, their fielding full of commitment and quality.
Shubman Gill had already gone for nine, beautifully bowled through the gate by Chris Woakes.
England have still not been eliminated from this competition and even after the guillotine falls they will have plenty of motivation for their three remaining fixtures.
